name: Sigma Epsilon Omega
description:
UC Berkeley’s first and only queer-founded fraternity, is a community built by and for LGBTQ+ students of all genders and identities. We are committed to creating a safe, affirming, and celebratory space centered on respect, equity, and chosen family. Founded by three queer students at UC Berkeley, SEO has and is continuing to break barriers and stereotypes of both the queer and Greek communities.

Founded in 2007 by three visionary students, SEO has grown from an Alpha Class of 23 to a network of more than 130 siblings, current members and alumni, breaking barriers in Greek life and thriving across diverse fields worldwide. In 2017, we celebrated our ten-year anniversary, and we continue to evolve as a home where queer and trans students can grow as leaders, friends, and changemakers.

Our siblinghood is grounded in activism, service, and joy. We engage in philanthropy, awareness campaigns, and volunteer efforts that uplift our communities, while also holding space for vibrant social connection and celebration of queer and trans identities.

SEO believes that Greek life should reflect the diversity and resilience of the LGBTQ+ community. We are proud to foster a siblinghood based on authenticity, solidarity, and opportunity for all, moving towards our vision for queer Greek-Life.

For questions or to connect with us, please email president@sigmaepsilonomega.org we'd love to hear from you!
summary: Sigma Epsilon Omega (SEO), UC Berkeleyâ€™s only queer fraternity, is a siblinghood inclusive of all genders and identities. Striving to create a supportive, inclusive, chosen-family community that queer and trans students can call home at Cal.
